metadata.title: CVE-2014-3677 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Shim might allow attackers to executearbitrary code via a crafted MOK list, which triggers memory corruption.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-3677` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

shim - 0.8-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: shim package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.8-0ubuntu2').
